page.title: 01Badlesmere : Introduction
page.content: This bloc covers four Parishes, namely Badlesmere, Leaveland, part of Sheldwich to the North and East and part of Molash in the South-East corner. It is situated on top of the North Downs, between 90 and ll5 metres above sea level, exposed to strong westerly winds with a higher rainfall than either Ashford or Faversham. Spring is about two weeks later than in Faversham. The soil type is clay with flints over chalk on the higher ground and brick earth around Badlesmere and Sheldwich. It is a rural area with large tracts of farm land, beech woods and mixed coppices sparsely populated in scattered farmsteads and small concentrations along the A251 and Badlesmere Lees. Lack of amenities is the predominant characteristic of the area.
